question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Network service events blocking] If network_service_events blocks indefinitely waiting for network activity, can this deadlock the entire JWK consensus system preventing liveness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Channel poisoning] Can an attacker fill the self_sender channel with 1,024 low-priority messages, blocking high-priority JWK quorum certificate messages from being processed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Runtime task starvation] With only 4 threads in the runtime, can long-running JWK observation computations starve other tasks, preventing timely RPC responses and causing peer timeouts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Event notification flood] Can an attacker trigger rapid reconfig_events or jwk_updated_events to overwhelm the epoch_manager's event processing loop, causing CPU exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Epoch boundary message handling] During epoch transitions, can messages from the old epoch be mistakenly processed in the new epoch context, causing JWK state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Old epoch task cleanup] When a new epoch starts, are tasks from the previous epoch properly terminated, or can old-epoch tasks continue sending messages causing protocol confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Epoch rollback attack] Can an attacker cause the JWK consensus system to process epochs out of order by manipulating reconfig_events, potentially enabling double-spending of JWK updates? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Byzantine validator exclusion] If > 1/3 of validators are Byzantine and refuse to participate in JWK consensus, does the system detect this and maintain liveness with the honest minority? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Sybil attack via runtime duplication] Can a single physical validator run multiple JWK consensus runtimes with different my_addr values to simulate multiple validators and compromise quorum requirements? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Validator impersonation] Does the system verify that the validator key associated with my_addr matches the key in safety_rules_config, or can a validator use another validator's address? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Key rotation handling] If validator keys are rotated mid-epoch through safety_rules_config updates, can this cause signature verification failures for in-flight JWK messages? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Message tampering detection] Are messages passed through self_sender protected by MACs or signatures to detect tampering, or can in-memory message modification attacks succeed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Configuration integrity] Is safety_rules_config integrity-protected during transit from caller to EpochManager, or can memory corruption attacks modify it? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Clock skew handling] If validators have significantly different system clocks, can this cause timeouts or message rejections in JWK consensus leading to liveness failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Task scheduling fairness] Does the Tokio runtime fairly schedule network_task and epoch_manager tasks, or can one starve the other under heavy load? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Message protocol mismatch] Can the NetworkTask receive non-JWKConsensusMsg messages through network_service_events, causing deserialization panics or protocol confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [RPC response timeout] Are RPC timeouts in network_client properly configured to prevent indefinite blocking waiting for Byzantine validators' responses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [State recovery after crash] If the validator crashes and restarts, can the new runtime recover in-progress JWK consensus state from safety_rules_config, or is state lost causing protocol divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Persistent storage corruption] If safety_rules_config's underlying storage is corrupted, does initialization fail safely or proceed with invalid state causing Byzantine behavior? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Empty validator set] If the validator set is empty during initialization, does the code handle this gracefully or panic causing validator unavailability? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Single validator scenario] In a single-validator test network, can the self-messaging logic create deadlocks or livelocks in JWK consensus? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Maximum validator set size] With a very large validator set (thousands of validators), does the channel buffer size of 1,024 become insufficient causing message drops? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Tokio runtime vulnerabilities] Can vulnerabilities in the underlying Tokio runtime (spawn_named_runtime) be exploited to gain control of JWK consensus execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [aptos_channels security] Are there known vulnerabilities in aptos_channels that could allow channel injection, message reordering, or DoS attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_jwk_consensus_runtime()] [Metric poisoning] Can an attacker manipulate the PENDING_SELF_MESSAGES counter to hide capacity issues or trigger false alarms in monitoring systems? (Low)
